    Access Ulster

    Do you need to access specialist expertise, equipment or research to grow and develop your business?

    The Access Ulster portal makes it easier for you to find what you need and access Ulster's publications, technologies, facilities and expertise.

    1. Search for what you need in the search field e.g. 'composites'.
    2. Results show Ulster University experts; publications; equipment; and technologies for licensing for that query term.
    3. Contact Us for more information or to talk to one of our Business Development Managers.


    Access Ulster

    Business Development Manager Contacts

    Our Business Development team are here to help match your requirements to the right expert or equipment; guide you through the consultancy process; and advise on various consultancy funding programmes available.

      Amanda Fullerton

      Knowledge Exchange Manager - KTP

      Innovation & Impact

      +44 28 7167 5074
      a.fullerton@ulster.ac.uk
      MF226C - Magee campus
      • Key responsibilities
        • Championing the Knowledge Transfer Partnerships programme (KTP) and adding value through research income generation
        • Stimulating leading Knowledge Exchange collaborations between the University’s researchers and  N.I. businesses
        • Delivering demonstrable results for the University’s Research & Impact Agenda

    Technologies Available for Licensing

    We offer a selection of new ideas and technologies that are available to review, evaluate, collaborate, licence and take to market.

    For more information on how to access these technologies or discuss a particular technology contact:

      Dr John MacRae

      Commercialisation Manager

      Innovation & Impact

      +44 28 9036 6706
      j.macrae@ulster.ac.uk
      26A27 - Jordanstown campus
      • Key responsibilities
        • Validating economic potential of research outcomes and developing commercial impact
        • Championing the Proof of Concept programme institutionally
        • Educating and training University researchers in commercialisation, demonstrating its contribution to research impact

        Find out more about Dr John MacRae

    • Dr John MacRae

      Commercialisation Manager Innovation & Impact +44 28 9036 6706 j.macrae@ulster.ac.uk 26A27 - Jordanstown campus

      Key responsibilities

      • Validating economic potential of research outcomes and developing commercial impact
      • Championing the Proof of Concept programme institutionally
      • Educating and training University researchers in commercialisation, demonstrating its contribution to research impact

      Find out more about Dr John MacRae

    Research

    With 15 Research Institutes and affiliated research centres Ulster University has built an exceptionally strong reputation for internationally excellent research and innovation, helped by the seamless transfer of ideas from the research lab to the marketplace.

    If you are interested in accessing our research, working with us on a research collaboration project, or research studentship, contact:

      Gemma McCaw

      Clerical Assistant

      Research Development

      +44 28 7012 4597
      g.mccaw@ulster.ac.uk
      J705 - Coleraine campus
      • Key responsibilities
        • Clerical support for Research Development team
        • Organise meetings, workshops and arrangements for visitors and speakers at events
        • Diary management

        Find out more about Gemma McCaw

    • Gemma McCaw

      Clerical Assistant Research Development +44 28 7012 4597 g.mccaw@ulster.ac.uk J705 - Coleraine campus

      Key responsibilities

      • Clerical support for Research Development team
      • Organise meetings, workshops and arrangements for visitors and speakers at events
      • Diary management

      Find out more about Gemma McCaw

    Funding Support Programmes

    There are a range of funding programmes available to support innovation and R&D activities in collaboration with Ulster University:

    Short Term Projects

    funding programmes such as Innovation Vouchers run by Invest Northern Ireland and Enterprise Ireland can help SME's access university expertise via a voucher worth up to £4,000/€5,000 to deliver innovative solutions.

    Long Term Projects

    Innovative and research focused development programmes such as UK Knowledge Transfer Partnerships programme or InterTradeIreland's FUSION programme can help support innovation and R&D.

    Research

    R&D grants from organisations such as Invest Northern Ireland and Innovate UK can support business with finance for research and development.

    European Funding

    Horizon 2020 is one of the largest programmes in Europe for supporting innovation and collaboration between SMEs and academic institution.

    Media/PR Enquiries

    Contact our PR & Communications team by calling +44 28 9036 6178 or emailing pressoffice@ulster.ac.uk
